channel.title: Thiefs in Steam
channel.description:
I got a message from stranger. He give me this link and said, that Nvidia give me three free games. I click on that link. [url][COLOR='Red']link removed[/url]
All looks like steam community page, except that sentence: [i][COLOR='YellowGreen']Nvidia Gives you 3 STEAM GAMES FOR FREE You need only login and select 3 any games. Good gaming by NVIDIA![/i]
I was thinking about one thing - [b]they want to steal my account[/b], but i wasn't sure. So, I create new account (without any games) and I "log in". What happened? I click log in key and [b]NOTHING HAPENNED[/b]. I was again on that page. What to do when you get that message? [b][u][COLOR='Red']NOTHING!!! DO NOT TELL THEM YOUR PASSWORD!!![/u][/b]
P.S. I am not dumb, and I'll never tell my password to anyone :smiley:
[COLOR='red']CatzEyes93: I removed the link to prevent idiots from clicking to see what you are talking about.

item.title: Thiefs in Steam
item.dc:creator: koolkalang
item.description:
I fell for this last month. Not the 3 games per say, but something similar. was a pain to recover, but nothing unreasonable. This actually made me slightly more productive than usual, what with not being able to log on to steam.

Read full topic

item.title: Thiefs in Steam
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
Ond kaja:

I got the exact same message, and I got three steam games for free. Maybe you are using an ATI-card or something.

I should ban you for leading people to think that it is perfectly safe to click links they shouldnt be clicking.

Your in my scope buddy. See me lookin at you? yeah… you. Keep sharp princess cuz it can hurt.

Read full topic

item.title: Thiefs in Steam
item.dc:creator: Jingles
item.description:
I got the same message, but it was not to do with NVidia, it just linked me to some romanian site, and said that I had as many free games as I wanted, I did not click on on it, but ti was something like freesteamsgames.storepowered.co.ro or something like that. That is not an actual link, also, it completely mirrored steam apart from a sentence.

Read full topic

item.title: Thiefs in Steam
item.dc:creator: Ond_kaja
item.description:
Mateuuuusz:

I got a message from stranger. He give me this link and said, that Nvidia give me three free games. I click on that link. [COLOR=‘Red’]link removed

All looks like steam community page, except that sentence:
[COLOR=‘YellowGreen’]Nvidia Gives you 3 STEAM GAMES FOR FREE
You need only login and select 3 any games.
Good gaming by NVIDIA!

I was thinking about one thing - they want to steal my account, but i wasn’t sure. So, I create new account (without any games) and I “log in”.
What happened? I click log in key and NOTHING HAPENNED. I was again on that page.
What to do when you get that message?
[COLOR=‘Red’]NOTHING!!! DO NOT TELL THEM YOUR PASSWORD!!!

P.S.
I am not dumb, and I’ll never tell my password to anyone

[COLOR=‘red’]CatzEyes93: I removed the link to prevent idiots from clicking to see what you are talking about.

I got the exact same message, and I got three steam games for free. Maybe you are using an ATI-card or something.

Read full topic
